verses.kjv: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Job from the whirlwind and said,

verses.kjv: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
verses.ct: "Who is this that clouds my purposes with ignorant words?

verses.kjv: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
verses.ct: Prepare yourself like a man, because I am going to question you, and you will answer me.

verses.kjv: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
verses.ct: Where were you when I established the foundations of the earth? Tell me, if you actually understand.

verses.kjv: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
verses.ct: Who determined its dimensions — do you know? Who stretched a measuring line across it?

verses.kjv: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
verses.ct: What are its foundations anchored to? Who set its cornerstone in place

verses.kjv: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
verses.ct: while the morning stars sang in harmony and all the sons of God erupted in celebration?

verses.kjv: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
verses.ct: Who held back the sea behind barriers when it burst out, as though born from a womb?

verses.kjv: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,
verses.ct: I wrapped it in clouds as its clothing and thick darkness as its blanket.

verses.kjv: And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,
verses.ct: I established its boundaries, putting up gates and bars,

verses.kjv: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
verses.ct: and I said, 'You may come this far but no farther — here your surging waves must stop.'

verses.kjv: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;
verses.ct: Have you ever, in all your life, commanded the morning to begin or assigned the dawn its position,

verses.kjv: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
verses.ct: so that it grips the edges of the earth and shakes the wicked out of it?

verses.kjv: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.
verses.ct: The earth takes shape like clay pressed under a seal, and its features stand out like the folds of a garment.

verses.kjv: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
verses.ct: The wicked lose the light they rely on, and their raised fist of power is shattered.

verses.kjv: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
verses.ct: Have you traveled to the springs at the bottom of the sea? Have you walked along the floor of the deep?

verses.kjv: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
verses.ct: Have the gates of death been revealed to you? Have you seen the entrance to the realm of utter darkness?

verses.kjv: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
verses.ct: Do you grasp the full extent of the earth? Tell me, if you know all of this.

verses.kjv: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
verses.ct: Where does light have its home? And darkness — where does it reside,

verses.kjv: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?
verses.ct: so that you could escort each one back to its territory and know the paths leading to its dwelling?

verses.kjv: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?
verses.ct: Surely you must know, since you were already alive back then — after all, you've lived so many years!

verses.kjv: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
verses.ct: Have you visited the storehouses of the snow? Have you seen where the hail is kept,

verses.kjv: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
verses.ct: which I have stockpiled for times of crisis, for days of conflict and war?

verses.kjv: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
verses.ct: By what route is light distributed, or the east wind scattered across the earth?

verses.kjv: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
verses.ct: Who carved out channels for the torrents of rain, or a path for the thunderbolt,

verses.kjv: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
verses.ct: to bring rain on land where no one lives, on deserts with not a single person,

verses.kjv: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
verses.ct: to drench the barren wasteland and make fresh green shoots sprout from the ground?

verses.kjv: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
verses.ct: Does the rain have a father? Who fathered the drops of dew?

verses.kjv: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
verses.ct: From whose womb did the ice emerge? Who gave birth to the frost of heaven?

verses.kjv: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
verses.ct: Water becomes hard as stone, and the surface of the deep freezes solid.

verses.kjv: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
verses.ct: Can you fasten the chains of the Pleiades or loosen the belt of Orion?

verses.kjv: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
verses.ct: Can you bring out the constellations in their proper season, or guide Arcturus and its companion stars?

verses.kjv: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?
verses.ct: Do you know the laws that govern the heavens? Can you impose their authority on the earth?

verses.kjv: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
verses.ct: Can you shout orders to the clouds and make a flood of water pour down on you?

verses.kjv: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?
verses.ct: Can you dispatch bolts of lightning so they go and report back to you, 'Here we are'?

verses.kjv: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
verses.ct: Who placed wisdom deep within a person? Who gave the mind its ability to understand?

verses.kjv: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
verses.ct: Who has the wisdom to count the clouds? Who can tip over heaven's water jars

verses.kjv: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
verses.ct: when the dust hardens into a mass and the clumps of soil stick tightly together?

verses.kjv: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
verses.ct: Can you hunt prey for the lioness or satisfy the hunger of young lions

verses.kjv: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
verses.ct: when they crouch in their dens or lie hidden in the brush, waiting to ambush?

verses.kjv: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
verses.ct: Who provides food for the raven? Its young cry out to God, wandering around desperate for something to eat."
